intro: Galium javanicum var. javanicum, commonly known as the Java bedstraw, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are usually oval to lance-shaped with a slightly hairy surface. Galium javanicum var. javanicum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
